definition: to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to try hard to catch up
to deliver a frontal assault/to meet head-on (idiom)
erhua variant of 迎頭|迎头[ying2 tou2]

sentences.english: Although the gendarmerie is ahead of the market the market is catching up.
sentences.chinese: 虽然宪兵，是市场上的领先地位，市场正在迎头赶上。

sentences.english: Paul was badly injured when his car was in head-on collision with a bus.
sentences.chinese: 保尔的汽车同一辆公共汽车迎头相撞时，受了重伤。

sentences.english: The ship struck the rocks head on .
sentences.chinese: 那只船迎头撞上了礁石。

sentences.english: Just after doing that, he crushed into a group of pigs.
sentences.chinese: 才刚骂完，他便迎头撞上一群过马路的猪。

sentences.english: The Federals kept on coming long past the point where all the pleasure of whipping them vanished.
sentences.chinese: 迎头痛击的乐趣早已消失，北军仍在冲锋。

sentences.english: In the second trial your trucks meet head-on travelling up the one-way road.
sentences.chinese: 在第二次试验中，双方的卡车在单行道上迎头相遇。

sentences.english: He was badly injured when his car was in head-on collision with a bus.
sentences.chinese: 他的车和一辆公共汽车迎头相撞，受了重伤。

sentences.english: He greeted me with a stream of abuse.
They made head against the enemy.
Skyfire fires up fast and web pages load quickly.
sentences.chinese: 天火大火迎头赶上和网页加载迅速。

sentences.english: China may just leave them in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 中国会迎头而上而你们只能在后面望尘莫及。

sentences.english: The science has caught up and the shamans are exposed.
sentences.chinese: 科学已经迎头赶上，巫师的丑恶嘴脸终被曝光。

sentences.english: Europe is extraordinarily chic in Beijing nowadays; the city is making up for lost time.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲人在北京现在很时尚，北京城正在努力迎头赶上。

sentences.english: Spain and France remain the biggest markets, but China is catching up.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙和法国仍是最大市场，但中国正迎头赶上。

sentences.english: Not only had they not kept up, they'd fallen behind.
sentences.chinese: 他们不仅没有迎头赶上，反而是掉队了。

sentences.english: Gawain refuses, determined to meet his fate head-on.
sentences.chinese: 加文拒绝，决心迎接他的命运迎头。

definition: coming right into one's face/imminent/to put first
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4
